did.abstract: This collection details experience of Nicholas L. Cipu as he served with the U.S. Army in Europe during World War II. The collection contains video of an oral history interview conducted in 2006.
did.physloc: Center for Public Policy and Social Research (CPPSR) 207 DiLoreto Hall, Central Connecticut State University (CCSU) 1615 Stanley St. New Britain, CT 06050

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nicholas L. Cipu was drafted into the U.S. Army in July of 1942 just a few weeks after he married. He was sent to Camp Gruber in Oklahoma for basic training, where he became part of the 88th infantry division, also known as the "Blue Devils"" His unit arrived in Casablanca in December of 1943, where they underwent more training in preparation for combat in the Italian theater. Cipu fought near Naples, Italy, and it was in October of 1944 that he was wounded seriously, for which he received a Purple Heart. He was discharged in October of 1945 because of the disability he incurred from his injury. Cipu returned home and used the GI Bill to pay for training in watchmaking. He retired after a long career in mechanical engineering.
